Client Service Officer Job at CoolFM / WazobiaFM




        
    

        
        CoolFM / WazobiaFM is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Client Service Officer

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reporting Line: Reports directly to the Sales Manager

About the Role
     

            
    




	CWIAK is hiring a dynamic Client Service Officer to join our growing team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving revenue growth through advertising and sponsorship sales across our radio stations.
	You will engage directly with clients and media agencies to promote radio as an effective advertising medium, while building strong, long-lasting business relationships.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and secure new business opportunities to meet and exceed revenue targets
	Engage with prospects and clients to gather briefs and understand their advertising needs
	Prepare and present compelling sales proposals and campaign solutions
	Develop creative advertising strategies tailored to client goals
	Maintain and update client databases with relevant needs and targets
	Work closely with internal departments to ensure high-quality service delivery
	Provide regular revenue forecasts and activity reports.


Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Achievement of monthly sales targets
	Number of new leads generated and converted
	Conversion rate and average time to close deals.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in any relevant field
	2 years of proven experience in a sales or client-facing role (2 - 3 years experience in media sales is an advantage)
	Training: Yes – Successful applicant(s) will be trained
	Proximity to Victoria Island is an added advantage.


Key Competencies:


	Excellent communication and negotiation skills
	Strong interpersonal and relationship-building abilities
	Effective time-management and organizational skills
	Resilient, self-driven, and target-oriented
	Adaptable and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
Competitive.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cobanye@coolwazobiainfo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be shortlisted.

Front Desk / Administrative Officer Job at BRAVION Group of Companies Limited




        
    

        
        BRAVION Group of Companies Limited is a progressive, technology-centric group with businesses across the construction, manufacturing, mining, oil and gas and real estate sectors. From an idea birthed in 2005, we have built solid relationships with industry leaders in Nigeria and Nations across Sub-Saharan Africa; by conducting our business in the most ethical and mutually beneficial manner.

We have become a holding company of an indigenous conglomerate that comprises Eight vibrant member companies. We aim to become Africa's leading company by pioneering global best practices and playing an integral role in achieving Africa's unlimited potential.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk / Administrative Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are seeking a friendly and organized Front Desk and Administrative Officer to join our team at BravionGroup.
	This role requires someone passionate about providing exceptional customer relationship management, both internal and external to ensure each client’s experience is relaxing, positive, and memorable.
	As the first point of contact, you’ll be instrumental in welcoming clients, managing bookings, handle efficient tele-communications and assisting with inquiries.


Roles and Responsibilites


	Greet clients warmly and ensure a welcoming atmosphere.
	Manage the front desk, ensuring a tidy and organized reception area.
	Maintain accurate records, files, and databases.
	Managing client appointments, bookings, and follow-up calls.
	Answer, Direct, and respond to phone calls, emails, and message inquiries in the various allocated platforms promptly and professionally.
	Provide information on all the company’s services, promotions, and packages.
	Maintain accurate records of client details, logs and bookings.
	Address client concerns, resolve any issues with a positive approach and escalate to management when necessary.
	Collaborate with team members to ensure smooth daily operations.
	Coordinate travel arrangements, meetings and appointments.
	Generate sales leads through outbound calls/inbound calls, emails, and social medias
	Build relationship with potential clients, identifying business opportunities.
	Meet expected targets and report to line manager promptly on daily basis.
	Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.
	Perform other duties as assigned by the management.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 7 years of work experience.


Salary
N170,000 - N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: jobs@bravion-group.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Administrative Officer Job at University of Port Harcourt




        
    

        
        The University of Port Harcourt, a Centre of Academic Excellence with a mandate to provide qualitative and research oriented education in the Niger Delta region and Nigeria at large, is an entrepreneurial University acting in consonance with the regulations of the National University Commission (NUC).
     

            
    



At University of Port Harcourt, we believe in the transformative power of education and the boundless potential within every individual. Established in 1975 as a College of the University of Lagos and gained full autonomous status in 1977, we have been dedicated to fostering intellectual curiosity, academic excellence, and a vibrant campus community. The University of Port Harcourt is situated in Choba/Aluu town in Rivers State, Nigeria in the South-South geo-political zone. Currently, the University has one (1) College, twelve (12) Faculties, and seven (7) Schools.

Applications are invited from suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers

Requirements


	Candidates must possess an Honours Degree (minimum of Second-class Lower Division) from a recognized Higher Institution, plus NYSC Discharge/Exemption/Exclusion Certificate with at least 3 years of cognate experience in University Administration, any other Institution of Higher Learning, Public/well established private sector.
	By appointment of a candidate possessing a Master’s Degree in the relevant Field, plus NYSC Discharge/ Exemption/Exclusion Certificate.


Note


	Candidates should sign up, login and submit their applications with detailed curriculum vitae and certificates.
	Only degrees and certificates awarded by Government approved institutions will be recognized.

Business Development Manager Job at EnvironQuest Limited




        
    

        
        EnvironQuest was founded in 2001, and since then, we've made it our mission to provide scientifically sound, cost-effective integrated solutions for our customers so they can protect and preserve the environment without sacrificing their ambitions for business growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location: Lagos State
empployment Type: Full-time
Supervisor: General Manage

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Business Development Executive will proactively identify new business opportunities, strengthen client relationships, and support the development of proposals and tenders for environmental and ESG-related services.
	The role is focused on growing market presence across key sectors (oil & gas, power, infrastructure, financial institutions) and positioning the company as a trusted partner in Nigeria’s evolving regulatory and sustainability landscape.


Duties


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities, particularly within oil & gas, power, infrastructure, and financial sectors (25%).
	Build and manage relationships with existing and prospective clients, including multinationals, regulators, and financiers (20%).
	Coordinate and contribute to technical and commercial proposals, EOIs, and tender submissions (20%).
	Track industry trends, regulatory developments (NUPRC, NESREA, LFN), and competitor activity to inform strategy (15%).
	Collaborate with technical teams and subject-matter experts to align BD activities with delivery capacity (10%).
	Maintain accurate records of leads, pipelines, and performance metrics using CRM tools; prepare weekly BD reports (10%).


Requirements
Qualification:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Environmental Science, Business, Engineering, or related field.
	Master’s Degree or relevant professional certification (e.g., IEMA, ISO, GRI) is an advantage.


Experience:


	5 – 8 years of experience in business development, preferably in consulting, environmental services, or infrastructure sectors.
	Proven track record of winning or supporting bids over ?50M.
	Experience working with regulatory agencies and multinational clients in Nigeria.


Key Competencies:


	Business acumen and sector knowledge.
	Sales and persuasive communication skills.
	Client relationship management.
	Proposal writing and bid coordination.
	Strategic thinking and opportunity positioning.
	Self-management and ability to meet targets.


Desirable Competencies:


	Familiarity with Nigerian regulatory frameworks (NUPRC, NESREA, LFN).
	Knowledge of ESG trends and sustainability reporting frameworks.
	Entrepreneurial mindset and resilience in a fast-paced consultancy environment.
	Ability to develop long-term partnerships and strategic alliances.


Skills:


	Strong business acumen in environmental and ESG consulting services (ESIA, audits, risk assessments, due diligence, sustainability reporting).
	Excellent sales, negotiation, and communication skills, with ability to pitch technical services persuasively.
	Skilled in proposal writing, bid coordination, and structured documentation.
	Strong presentation and client engagement skills.
	Proficiency in CRM tools and Microsoft Office Suite.


Conditions of Employment


	Full-time role based in Lagos, Nigeria.
	Requires flexibility for client meetings, sector events, and occasional travel.
